body: Based on Windows docker scripts with some tweaks: * add parameter `CROSS_COMPILE` for switching between Cygwin and Docker: * `true` for Docker * `false` for Cygwin * disable `set -e -x` because some dependencies builds fail due to that * remove prefix and tmp folders to run a clean build each time * build **Opus** from tarball not from git clone because `autogen.sh` failed on Cygwin due to some error with `ltmain.sh` symlink: ```bash Updating build configuration files, please wait.... libtoolize: putting auxiliary files in '.'. libtoolize: linking file './ltmain.sh' autoreconf-2.69: libtoolize failed with exit status: 1 ``` * add `-fstack-protector` to `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS` and `-lssp` when creating `libtox.dll` to fix (https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages/issues/5868) * change `libwinpthread.a` folder for `libtox.dll` * disable chmod --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1537)

comment_data.body: We are already in a `if [ "${CROSS_COMPILE}" = "true" ]; then` block, why check it again?

Yeah, you're right.
I forgot to clean this up when I was trying to get `libtox.dll` thing work.

comment_data.body:
`autogen.sh` failing for libsodium (like for opus).
[Full log](https://gist.github.com/redmanmale/5339923bcb567460afc4bcd198230c19).

Perhaps I could build libsodium from tarball like Opus than I could propably enable back `set -e -x` thing.

Edit: building libsoduim from tarball failing with [another error](https://gist.github.com/redmanmale/c0534ec13d11886313dbf4aa9191d272).

comment_data.body:
Ah, now I see why you were complaining about the removal of `$CROSS_COMPILE` things. You have made a mistake in your initial commit which I didn't notice, which then caused this confusion about the removal.

In your initial commit [this if-statement's `then` and `else` bodies are swapped](https://github.com/nurupo/InsertProjectNameHere/commit/8a1f149bd0cf94686842b522bf8703e5b435474f#diff-86b73a62db12c39395a4ef2111140e6b50743f43e8202f3d745a204f9b9042eeR116-R120), i.e.:

```C
  if [ "${CROSS_COMPILE}" = "true" ]; then
    LIBWINPTHREAD="/usr/${WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN}/sys-root/mingw/lib/libwinpthread.a"
  else
    LIBWINPTHREAD="/usr/${WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN}/lib/libwinpthread.a"
  fi
```

which didn't work for me when testing cross-compiling a few days ago, as the correct path when cross-compiling is `/usr/${WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN}/lib/libwinpthread.a` - the same path you have specified for the Cygwin build. So since they are the same path there was no point in that if-statement and I have removed it. Now I see that you meant to have those two bodies swapped.

-        if [ "${ALLOW_TEST_FAILURE}" = "true" ]; then
-            set +e
-        fi
-        cmake --build . --target test -- ARGS="-j50"
-        if [ "${ALLOW_TEST_FAILURE}" = "true" ]; then
-            set -e
-        fi
-    fi
+    winecfg
+    export CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE=1
+    # add libgcc_s_sjlj-1.dll libwinpthread-1.dll into PATH env var of wine
+    export WINEPATH="$(
+      cd /usr/lib/gcc/"$WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN"/*posix/
+      winepath -w "$PWD"
+    )"\;"$(winepath -w /usr/"$WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN"/lib/)"
 
-    # move static dependencies
-    cp "${STATIC_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR}"/* "${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}" -R
-    cp "${DEP_PREFIX_DIR}"/* "${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}" -R
-
-    # make libtox.dll
-    cd "${SHARED_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR}"
-    for archive in ${STATIC_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/libtox*.a
-    do
-        ${WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN}-ar xv ${archive}
-    done
-    ${WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN}-gcc -Wl,--export-all-symbols \
-                             -Wl,--out-implib=libtox.dll.a \
-                             -shared \
-                             -o libtox.dll \
-                             *.obj \
-                             ${STATIC_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/*.a \
-                             ${DEP_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/*.a \
-                             /usr/${WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN}/lib/libwinpthread.a \
-                             -liphlpapi \
-                             -lws2_32 \
-                             -static-libgcc
-    cp libtox.dll.a ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/lib
-    mkdir -p ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/bin
-    cp libtox.dll ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/bin
-
-    rm -rf /tmp/*
-
-    # remove everything from include directory except tox headers
-    mv ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/include/tox ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/tox
-    rm -rf ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/include/*
-    mv ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/tox ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/include/tox
-
-    sed -i "s|^prefix=.*|prefix=${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}|g" ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/pkgconfig/*.pc
-    sed -i "s|^libdir=.*|libdir=${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/lib|g" ${RESULT_PREFIX_DIR}/lib/*.la
+    if [ "$ALLOW_TEST_FAILURE" = "true" ]; then
+      set +e
+    fi
+    cmake --build . --target test -- ARGS="-j50"
+    if [ "$ALLOW_TEST_FAILURE" = "true" ]; then
+      set -e
+    fi
+  fi
+
+  # move static dependencies
+  cp -a "$STATIC_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR"/* "$RESULT_PREFIX_DIR"
+  cp -a "$DEP_PREFIX_DIR"/* "$RESULT_PREFIX_DIR"
+
+  # make libtox.dll
+  cd "$SHARED_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR"
+  for archive in "$STATIC_TOXCORE_PREFIX_DIR"/lib/libtox*.a; do
+    "$WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN"-ar xv "$archive"
+  done
+
+  if [ "$CROSS_COMPILE" = "true" ]; then
+    LIBWINPTHREAD="/usr/$WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN/lib/libwinpthread.a"
+  else
+    LIBWINPTHREAD="/usr/$WINDOWS_TOOLCHAIN/sys-root/mingw/lib/libwinpthread.a"
+  fi

Please don't disable `set -e -x`. It's purpose is exactly what you are observing - fail the whole compilation process if any of individual commands fail. Without it you can have silent failures that can affect the build with the build seemingly succeeding. Instead, identify the commands that fail, try to make so that they don't fail, and if not possible, add `|| true` to them.

>Please don't disable set -e -x. It's purpose is exactly what you are observing - fail the whole compilation process if any of individual commands fail. Without it you can have silent failures that can affect the build with the build seemingly succeeding. Instead, identify the commands that fail, try to make so that they don't fail, and if not possible, add || true to them.

I understand its purpose but for some reason with them some deps builds (`autogen` or `configure`) just fail. How could it be work around with `|| true`?

Could get logs.
I'd like to try one more thing.
Finally get `libtox.dll` working.

I don't know what's wrong with this Codacity.
It was like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6782721/83046868-4a252e80-a050-11ea-8002-94f9f8a34b0b.png)

I removed and added spaces as it tells me.

Now it tells me the opposite: add spaces to the fist two lines.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6782721/83047066-8bb5d980-a050-11ea-817e-1af631ba70c5.png)
@redmanmale could you check "Allow edits by maintainers" checkbox on this PR? Want to try resolve Codacy issues. It should be under the participant list.

It's already checked.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6782721/83304392-746d1c80-a207-11ea-90a0-ac1aebcdd041.png)

Huh, GitHub doesn't want to work with me.

```bash
$ git push git@github.com:redmanmale/toxcore.git redmanmale-cygwin-build:cygwin-build
ERROR: Permission to redmanmale/toxcore.git denied to nurupo.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
```

No idea why I'm unable to add commits to the PR branch.

I have pushed some commits to [`redmanmale-cygwin-build` branch](https://github.com/nurupo/InsertProjectNameHere/commits/redmanmale-cygwin-build), fixing restyled, CodeFactory and Codacy issues (man, iphy went overboard with these checks!), rewording INSTALL.md and rebasing on master.

>I have pushed some commits to redmanmale-cygwin-build branch, fixing restyled, CodeFactory and Codacy issues (man, iphy went overboard with these checks!), rewording INSTALL.md and rebasing on master.

I meant to ask to replace contents of PR ranch with my branch. It has been rebased on master, so it won't merge cleanly on top of the PR branch, you would need to undo your commits `git reset --hard HEAD~5` and then it would merge. You would need to force-push afterwards.

I can open a PR on my own if that's easier on you.
Just wanted to re-run circleci tests but they failed again.
@nurupo what I need to do to get this merged?
I'm working on getting this up-to-date locally, will push when I fix some things.
In your last commit (https://github.com/nurupo/InsertProjectNameHere/commit/3dec63afa39ec197fd9da1d04e2684eca2b6ccec) you've undone the whole cross-compile stuff...

Because those if-s are no longer needed after I have updated the deps and Debian version in Docker. I have tested it and it cross-compiles without these things now. Please check if it still compiles in Cygwin, I don't have a Windows install handy to test that.

>whole

Not whole, there is still at least one `$CROSS_COMPILE` somewhere in there, those that I have left in should still be needed.

Updated commits with yours and Restyled's fixes in the `redmanmale-cygwin-build` branch of https://github.com/nurupo/InsertProjectNameHere.

The only thing I didn't fix is putting quotes around `$CURL_OPTIONS`, as that would break the `curl` invocation. It's a false positive from Restyle/shellharden.
Oh, I didn't notice that the Codacy check is failing too due to INSTALL.md formatting. Let me fix that...
Fixed and pushed.

Alright, looks good to me. This is ready to get merged.

@iphydf @robinlinden ping ping ping. Can you get this merged? GitHub won't let me due to the checks:

```sh
$ git push origin master 
warning: not sending a push certificate since the receiving end does not support --signed push
Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
remote: error: GH006: Protected branch update failed for refs/heads/master.
remote: error: 4 of 13 required status checks have not succeeded: 1 expected, 1 failing, and 2 pending.
To github.com:TokTok/c-toxcore.git
 ! [remote rejected]   master -> master (protected branch hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'github.com:TokTok/c-toxcore.git'
```

Regarding the failed checks:

- Codacy can't make up its mind about adding or removing 2 spaces before the list bullets, so I give up on it. Even now it suggests adding 2 spaces for some lines and removing 2 spaces for other, when it's supposed to be a single level list, there are no sub-lists in there...

- [restyled's fixes](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1685/commits/7203dddb8896b2b7626190bf4fec43220db98095) (Codacy complains about those too) of quoting variables containing multiple arguments to `cmake` and`curl` make those multiple arguments being passed as one, breaking those command invocations, so restyled should be ignored. However, it's a required check and I lack any permissions required to bypass it.
